newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan November gold imports seen sluggish.
newsitem.headline: Japan November gold imports seen sluggish.

text.p: Japan's gold imports in November are expected to remain low after falling in October as domestic demand, particularly from investors, remains sluggish, traders said on Thursday.
Gold imports in October tumbled 65.8 percent from a year earlier to 6.91 tonnes, compared with 20.20 tonnes in the same month last year, Finance Ministry data released on Thursday showed.
Imports in the first 10 months of 1996 totalled 119.88 tonnes, against 234.96 tonnes in the same period last year, the data showed.
"Japan's gold imports in November will remain low, although they could recover slightly to around 10 tonnes," a senior official of a major bullion house said.
Another bullion house official said traders were tending to buy gold from the domestic market, taking advantage of lower bullion prices in Tokyo.
"Gold imports from the spot market could be kept to a minimum for November due to bumper stocks and lower bullion prices here compared with the world benchmark," the official said.
